title: Yorkshire breaking news: Latest updates - BBC News
summary: school closes for day following death of pupil .
investigation into crash which killed five 'will take time ' .
hundreds of weapons handed in during county amnesty .
former soldiers released from indian jail after four years .
leader of bradford council warns of jobs cuts .
man killed walking along the a64 in north yorkshire .
motorcyclist dies two weeks after sheffield crash .
grant of £ 1.5m to help traumatised police officers .
ampleforth college apologises for past failings .
new online flooding alert service in calder valley .
cilla black musical comes to bradford .

documents.title: that 's all from tuesday
text: those are all our updates from across yorkshire on tuesday 28 november 2017 .
want to find out what 's happening where you live on wednesday ?
just click here .

documents.title: our top five stories today
text: well that 's all from us for today , we 'll be back tomorrow from 06:30 with all the latest news , sport , weather and travel across yorkshire .
updates on breaking news will continue throughout the night but before we go let 's look back at some of our top stories from today :
see you tomorrow .

documents.title: grammy awards : ed sheeran overlooked
text: there 's been shock in the music industry after halifax-born ed sheeran 's multi-million selling album has been excluded from the main categories at the 2018 grammy awards .
the move has surprised many industry observers with the star being edged out of contention by bruno mars and kendrick lamar , who each received multiple nominations .
however , sheeran did receive several nominations in the pop categories .
jay z leads with eight nominations , including his first-ever appearance in the album of the year list for 4:44 , which comes 21 years after his debut .
author: BBC Music

documents.title: listen : lena headey gives honest view of motherhood
text: huddersfield actor lena headey , best known as queen cersei lannister in games of thrones , has been open about her battle with post-natal depression while filming the first series of the hit show .
she 's shared her story as part of bbc 5 live 's # mumtakeover which aimed to be an honest and intimate conversation about parenting and mental health .
in this video from bbc 5 live the mum of two says looking after her family means she always comes last , but in a good way :

documents.title: follow us on instagram
text: we 've reached 11k followers on instagram !
are you one of them ?
we would love you to follow us at @ twitterid and if you have a great image of our region you would like to share , please tag us # bbcyorkshire .
author: Julia Bryson
Journalist, BBC Local Live

documents.title: travel update : slow journey home across leeds
text: not good news if you live in leeds this evening :
attn - major delays on services - congestion heavy on arterial routes heading out of the city - current delays up to 37 minutes .
shortened or full journey cancellations likely again this evening .
apologies for the delays .
rh .
maybe your drivers can use the stationary time to learn how to use the new ticket machines
terry , which service are you referring to ?
rh .
3 times in the last week a 15 minute journey on the 51/2 has taken 25 mins + because # worstbus has severe management failings and ca n't train staff properly
hi sorry to hear this and the inconvenience caused .
^vl
rather than say sorry every time why does n't # worstbus actually stop paying for naff marketing on twitter and invest in providing a decent service ?
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: breakingabout 1,000 homes without power in halifax
text: it appears that about 1,000 homes are without power in halifax this evening .
northern powergrid say they are working to resolve the issue as quickly as possible .
we know about the # powercut in # halifax # hx1 .
we 're working hard to get the power back on , thanks for your patience , updates to follow

documents.title: hundreds of weapons handed in during amnesty
text: more than 200 guns , knives and swords have been handed to the police in west yorkshire during a national weapons amnesty .
officers say a large number of shotguns were handed over including pump action and semi automatic versions .
west yorkshire police say 215 weapons were handed in during the national firearms surrender period which had run from 13 november and finished on sunday .
they will now been checked to see if they have been used in a crime or be destroyed .
a large number of weapons have now been taken out of circulation meaning that they can never fall into the hands of those who mean harm ''

documents.title: have you seen missing teenager jack wilson ?
text: have you seen this missing teenager from leeds ?
jack wilson , aged 14 , was last seen three days ago at his home in morley .
he was wearing a white baseball cap , grey padded jacket , grey tracksuit bottoms and white trainers .
if you see him , call west yorkshire police on 101 and quote log number 2059 for 25 november .

documents.title: travel update : accident on m18 this evening
text: an accident on the m18 northbound is going to cause some major delays tonight :
accident and a lot of barrier damage # m18 north j3 - j4 congestion is building from j3 at doncaster # a1m collision recovery work is in progress 1 lane is open .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: wakefield hooker sio leaves club
text: wakefield hooker sio leaves club

documents.title: experts 'suspected ex-mayor misconduct '
text: experts 'suspected ex-mayor misconduct '

documents.title: girl , 7 , who died on school visit was 'lovely little girl '
text: a seven-year-old girl who died suddenly on a visit to a school in west yorkshire has been described as a `` lovely little girl who will be greatly missed '' .
birkby junior school in huddersfield has been closed today as a mark of respect following the death of aiman abdullah after she was taken `` suddenly and seriously ill '' yesterday .
headteacher susan davis said : `` we are all shocked and incredibly saddened by the tragic news , our thoughts are with aiman 's family at this difficult and distressing time '' .
aiman was treated at the scene but died in hospital shortly afterwards .

documents.title: teenager appears in court charged with manslaughter
text: a teenager has appeared before leeds youth court this afternoon charged with manslaughter .
it 's after a man was seriously injured outside mcdonalds in huddersfield at the beginning of october .
graham bell , aged 37 , suffered serious head injuries and later died in hospital .
the 16-year-old who was charged with his death will appear at leeds crown court on 4 january .

documents.title: yorkshire nursery supplies trees to scottish project
text: a tree nursery from north yorkshire has secured a contract to supply almost a million trees in scotland .
johnson 's of whixley near york has signed a deal with the scottish government to supply the trees for part of the aberdeen western peripheral route which is being built .
it 's one of the largest infrastructure projects in scotland .

documents.title: libor bank fines fund harrogate police treatment centre
text: a police charity that helps officers who have fallen ill has secured £ 1.5m in funds generated from libor fines imposed on uk banks .
the police treatment centre in harrogate also supports policemen with stress , anxiety and other conditions .
ceo patrick cairns said the centre was seeing a growing demand for psychological treatment from police officers .
libor is the rate at which banks lend to each other .

documents.title: british figure skating championships in sheffield
text: sheffield is hosting the british figure skating championships this week .
it sees the cream of the country 's performers competing for national titles .
on top of that some will be looking to stake their claim to a place at the winter olym in pyeongchang .
two such hopefuls are olympic hopefuls graham newberry and natasha mackay , both are looking to defend their titles in sheffield .
we have many talented and hungry skaters looking to take , or defend , that prestigious national title .
all great british skaters have made their mark at this event over the years , including torvill and dean who held the national title from 1978 - 1983 , reclaiming the title again in 1994 . ''
author: Kat Cowan
Reporter, BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: police wildlife officer wins national award
text: a north yorkshire wildlife crime officer has won a national award for his work in tackling rural crime .
sgt kev kelly was named wildlife law enforcer of the year at the wildlife crime conference - an accolade that is presented to an officer who has done the most to combat wildlife crime in the uk .
he has secured convinctions for bat disturbance , greater crested newt habitat destruction and raptor persecution .
i had no idea i had been nominated , so when i heard my work being read out , i was filled with excitement . ''

documents.title: mothers in bradford trained up to combat of extremism
text: mothers in bradford are being trained up in the latest efforts to tackle terrorism
mums from a range of backgrounds have been working together to learn about the risks of radicalisation and how to protect their children from extreme views .
so far they have been attending the courses voluntarily and not because their children are at any particular risk - the sessions are being funded by the government strategy prevent .
in the past the scheme has been criticised for focusing on muslim communities but this initiative is open to all and looks at the risks from islamist and far right groups .
the sessions have been running at six locations across the city and are run by the group empowering minds .
author: Abi Jaiyeola
Reporter, BBC Look North

documents.title: listen : no yorkshire-wide devolution deal until south yorkshire decides
text: the government 's again stated there can be no yorkshire-wide devolution deal until a south yorkshire one is completed .
barnsley and doncaster councils are holding a poll from friday to ask people which option they prefer .
but in response to a question from barnsley mp dan jarvis , chancellor philip hammond said the existing deal to get more decisions made in south yorkshire must be completed first :
author: Gina Bolton
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: four days of strike action at sheffield school
text: four days of strike action have been set by teachers at westways primary school in sheffield .
the national education union says it 's over loss of morale and increasing stress caused by `` escalating workloads and punitive scrutiny '' .
the union says talks with governors have failed to sort things out and that it regrets the disruption the action will have for pupils and parents .
the strike days called by the union are 6 , 7 , 12 and 13 december .
we 've approached the school for comment .

our dispute is about fair working conditions for the staff team , staff want to work with their leadership to provide a student experience based upon sound educational principles offering a broad and balanced curriculum through inspiring teaching ''
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: have you seen missing angela simmonite ?
text: police have released this cctv image of a woman who has been missing in sheffield since saturday .
angela simmonite , 57 , went missing on saturday after leaving her home in the ecclesfield area between 05:00 and 09:00 - she has n't been heard from since .
police say they 've been carrying out `` extensive searches '' around her home and have found fresh cctv of her on hinde house lane , at around 07:00 on the day she went missing .
it 's now the last confirmed sighting of her and if you have any information about where she is , south yorkshire police want you to call them on 101 .
this cctv image is the last confirmed sighting we now have of angela so i 'd urge anyone who saw her that morning , or since then , to please get in touch with us ''

documents.title: hundreds of weapons handed in during county amnesty
text: more than 200 weapons have been handed in during a fortnight 's amnesty held by police in south yorkshire .
it includes shotguns , rifles and pistols .
the force says it 's thankful that people have responded to make their communities safer .
i personally want to thank everyone who has taken the time to hand these weapons and ammunition in . ''
author: Rebecca Kerry
Journalist, BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: case against 'mad max biker ' dropped
text: case against 'mad max biker ' dropped

documents.title: travel : train problems in scarborough and filey due to damaged track
text: there are no trains running between scarborough , filey and bridlington due to damage to the track between hunmanby and bridlington .
engineers are carrying out emergency work in the area .
national rail enquiries says this will cause disruption on journeys between scarborough and hull .
services may be delayed by up to 40 minutes or cancelled .
any cancelled services will be replaced with a bus .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: new online flooding service in calder valley
text: people who live in the calder valley are being given a new online tool which could give them an early warning of flooding .

the environment agency is behind the idea and people will be able to see a 36 hour `` river forecast '' which covers the river calder at walsden , todmorden , hebden bridge , mytholmroyd and sowerby bridge .
the agency says that it should help people prepare for possible flooding and make them more aware of potential risks .
the forecasts are calculated by computer models that take into account data including current flows and expected rainfall .

documents.title: travel update : crash on m1 stops traffic
text: there 's about a mile of standing traffic on the m1 northbound in south yorkshire this lunchtime as traffic is being temporarily held following a crash .
it 's happened near barnsley between j36 and j37 .
highways england are now on scene , and have stopped the traffic while they deal with the accident .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: leeds stonegate road crash : emotions run high in grief stricken community
text: police have urged a grief-stricken community to come together in light of a horror car crash which killed five people .
author: Yorkshire Evening Post

documents.title: leeds halloween 'mad max biker ' case dropped
text: a case has been dropped against a man accused of being involved in a gang behind a halloween `` ride out '' which caused chaos in leeds .
thirteen people were jailed at leeds crown court after bikers tore through streets last year , which was likened to scenes from the film mad max .
hernani banza , 27 , of shafton view , leeds , had pleaded not guilty to causing a public nuisance charge .
the crown prosecution service offered no evidence against him .

documents.title: cctv released after man hit 'repeatedly ' on leeds bus
text: police have released of two people they want to speak to after a man was repeatedly punched in the face on a bus .
the bus was outside st jame 's hospital at the time of the attack at about 19:15 on 18 november .
a man punched the victim , a 34 year-old man , several times in the face leaving him badly injured , before running off the bus with a woman .
if you recognise them , you are asked to call west yorkshire police on 101 .

documents.title: national award for sheffield social worker
text: the national title of newly qualified children 's social worker of the year has been won by dean radford who works in shefffield .
he was nominated for his work with a woman who was terminally ill and her child .
he helped them by finding secure housing and support services and being there for the child when the mother died .
judges at the national awards praised his tenacity , and passion for social work .
it 's an extremely challenging role , which i do n't think you can appreciate until you 're actually doing the job .
it 's been an absolutely massive learning curve this year with so many challenges , so it 's great to be recognised . ''
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: breakingleader of bradford council warns of job cuts
text: the leader of bradford council is warning that more job cuts may be on the way next year .
the authority says an extra £ 7m of savings would have to be made by 2019 , with museums , libraries and adult social care all expected to face cuts .
the council say that since 2010 they have approved £ 255.8m of savings but need to close the gap on a further £ 30.7m .
they say some of these savings are already planned and further ones are proposed for consultation .
we will be half the size in 2020 that we were in 2010 .
in spite of the cuts , i want to thank staff for still delivering high quality public services . ''

documents.title: travel update : six miles of queues on the m62
text: there are queues of about six miles on the m62 eastbound just before j27 this morning .
it 's all because a broken down car has caused the closure of a lane .
people coming over from manchester on the m62 this morning will have been delayed by another broken down vehicle - this time a lorry - between j21 and j22 .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: man killed walking along the a64 in north yorkshire
text: a 26-year-old man has died after being hit by a car on the a64 near sherburn in ryedale .
the incident happened at 18:15 yesterday .
north yorkshire police say they believe the man had walked from scagglethorpe village to the a64 .
he died at the scene .
police are appealing for witnesses and the man 's family are being supported by specially-trained officers .
author: Elly Fiorentini
BBC Yorkshire Live

documents.title: watch : yorkshire artist 's work found in saleroom goes on display
text: the work of a largely unknown artist from yorkshire is being rediscovered .
sheila bownas was born in yorkshire .
a few years ago a textile house came across her work at auction and the journey to find out more began .
now you have a chance to see some of her work in harrogate .
author: Elly Fiorentini
BBC Yorkshire Live

documents.title: listen : telephone scam costs sheffield woman £ 10,000
text: a phone call claiming to be from a bank 's fraud team resulted in sarah harper from wadsley being tricked out of £ 10,000 .
the money was part of an inheritance and the caller managed to persuade her that someone had been able to compromise her account and that she was at risk of losing it :
the bbc has put together this advice to help people avoid bank fraud .
author: Dan Green
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: travel update : delays in leeds
text: not sure what the problem is yet at the roundabout on the leeds outer ring road , we 'll try to find out
buses - 33/33a - severe delays due to heavy congestion around fleece roundabout ( horsforth ) .
buses operating up to 45mins late .
^vl
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: musical about cilla 's life comes to bradford
text: a musical de the rise of one of britain 's best-loved entertainers - cilla black - starts at the alhambra in bradford tonight .
cilla the musical is an adaptation of the critically acclaimed tv series which first aired in 2014 .
it charts her first steps into the music industry by a young john lennon when he introduced her to music mogul brian epstein .
the musical contains some of her most famous songs , including anyone who had a heart , alfie and something tells me .

documents.title: company looking after vulnerable people criticised
text: a company providing home support to the most vulnerable adults and children in south yorkshire is being criticised over its standards of care .
casa doncaster looks after 44 people across the area .
a report by the care quality commission says the firm requires improvement in areas of safety , leadership and complying with regulations .
the cqc report says the the company lacked 'robust monitoring ' which meant it could n't be certain that care was being properly provided .
casa doncaster has responded to the report :
casa doncaster are very disappointed to receive a 'requires improvement ' rating , and are working hard to address the short-comings identified in their report .
since the inspection , we have changed the branch 's leadership team , and by mutual consent with the ccg , are transferring complex care packages to other providers . ''
author: Jenny Eells

documents.title: in yorkshire
text: it may be cold but the sun is shining .
take a look at these stunning images from around yorkshire from our bbc weather watchers .
the main is from badger taken in wales near rotherham .
on the right hand side from top to bottom is scarborough from binbo baggins , ampleforth from high lions and normanton taken by rogerair .
i 'm sure you 'll agree they are beautiful .
author: Elly Fiorentini
BBC Yorkshire Live

documents.title: grant of £ 1.5m to help traumatised police officers
text: the police treatment centre in harrogate has just secured money to help support police officers with stress , anxiety and similar conditions .
the £ 1.5m is a grant from the fines levied on the banking industry for manipulating the libor rate .
the centre says it is seeing a growing demand for psychological treatment for police officers .
ceo patrick cairns says they 're delighted with the grant and that they are the only police charity to receive money from the treasury under the libor scheme .
author: Elly Fiorentini
BBC Yorkshire Live

documents.title: sixty thousand pound drugs raid in sheffield
text: police say they 've discovered a large amount of drugs at a house in sheffield .
officers say £ 60,000 worth of cannabis was in a house on wadborough road , near the botanical gardens in the city .
they say it 's part of their efforts to tackle organised crime ; there were no arrests and investigations continue .
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: listen : uk snooker championships begin in york today
text: the 40th uk snooker championships gets underway in york later .
128 of the world 's best snooker players will be at the city 's barbican centre .
organisers say ticket sales this year are the 'best ever ' .
days of preparation have been going on to get everything ready .
ivan hirschowitz from world snooker says the biggest challenge is getting the tables set perfectly .

documents.title: man dies after sheffield crash
text: a 20-year-old man from sheffield has died after his motorbike left the road and hit some railings .
the accident was earlier this month on kenninghall road , heeley .
no other vehicles were involved .
in making their appeal for witnesses , police say the crash was on 14 november at about 13:30 and that the man was riding a red honda cbf motorbike .
author: Nick Wilson
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: travel : a64 broken down vehicle in a dangerous position
text: worth watching out for this one if you are travelling in the area .
a/insp paul cording

documents.title: chennai six : britons released from indian jail
text: six british former soldiers - including paul towers from pocklington - have been released from an indian prison four years after being arrested and detained on weapons charges .
the so-called chennai six , who had been guards on a ship to combat piracy in the indian ocean , won an appeal against their convictions on monday .
they have now been escorted out of chennai central prison by british consulate officials .
it said it was discussing the next step with the indian authorities .
lawyers representing the men say they will have to spend some more time in india before they can expect to return home .

documents.title: ampleforth college apologises for past failings
text: children at private catholic schools could be `` at risk '' of sexual abuse despite years of efforts to root out predators , an inquiry has heard .
an independent inquiry is being carried out into abuse at institutions , including the catholic church .
ampleforth college in north yorkshire and downside in somerset are currently under scrutiny .
representatives from both schools told the inquiry they apologised for past failings .
author: Elly Fiorentini
BBC Yorkshire Live

documents.title: listen : school closed for day after death of pupil
text: a huddersfield school is closed today following the sudden death of a pupil .
birkby junior school says it 's a mark of respect to the family of seven-year-old aiman abdullah who became ill during a visit to the north huddersfield trust school .
the school in fartown says it 's shocked and saddened by the news , and other children will get all the support they need .
nazia omar is a local mum .
author: Elly Fiorentini
BBC Yorkshire Live

documents.title: weather : wintry showers and sunshine
text: there 's a very wintry feel to today .
here 's my forecast .
author: Lisa Gallagher
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: listen : investigation into leeds car crash will take time
text: west yorkshire police say it will be some time before they truly understand what happened on saturday night when five people were killed in a car crash .
it happened in the meanwood area of leeds when a renault clio hit a tree on stonegate road .
just one 15 year old survived the crash .
superintendent matt davison is praising the way the people of meanwood have acted :
author: Sarah Wakefield
BBC Radio Leeds News

documents.title: travel : trains across yorkshire running on time this morning
text: if you 're heading to catch the train this morning , they 're all running on time from railway stations across yorkshire .
a reminder about wakefield westgate , where step-free access is unavailable at the station between platform one and all other platforms until further notice
you can keep an eye on journeys by clicking on the links below .
keep up-to-date with the live departure boards for :
author: Elly Fiorentini
BBC Yorkshire Live

documents.title: good morning : join us for today 's live coverage
text: hello and welcome to bbc local live in yorkshire on tuesday 28 november 2017 .
it is very cold in parts of yorkshire and you might need to to leave plenty of time to defrost your car !
but there 's sunshine on the way .
we 'll be with you until 18:00 with all the latest news , weather , travel and sport updates from across yorkshire .
i thought we 'd begin today with this of bradfield near sheffield from bbc weather watcher john leigh .
do n't you think it looks like a painting ?
if you have any moments of your own you 'd like to share with the rest of yorkshire , you can send them in by simply clicking here .
author: Elly Fiorentini
BBC Yorkshire Live
